Are the miners in different locations? You should confirm that you are successfully receiving requests from the main validators in the subnet; if this is the case then likely safe to ignore these messages.
The miners are on the same server. Yes, the logs don’t show which validator is sending these requests.

@taos・79 ☯️ Due to several unexpected delays in finalizing and testing the new and improved simulator/validator communication mechanism over the last week, we are releasing this along with a couple other updates today:

* **Simulator<->Validator Communication Optimization** : The upgraded mechanism for communication of state and instructions between simulator and validator has now been completed; the expected result is a substantial improvement in the simulation progression rate, an important consideration for a number of reasons, chief among which is the ability to produce a larger quantity of data and improve continuity of scoring results. 
* **Synapse Compression Optimization** : Testing and investigation towards minimizing the state processing time by validators led to some additional optimizations being achieved in the synapse compression; time taken in this process is reduced by a decent further margin, contributing also to improvement of the simulation progression rate.
* **Simulator Model Adjustments** : We deploy today some refinements to the parameters related to the interaction between the new mixed fractional Brownian motion and the background agents, further improving the realism of the market momentums and other key behavioural matters. An additional enhancement to the background model has also been prepared and included; stylized background agents will now leverage a HARA utility function to capture evolving risk preferences, fostering dynamic evolution and emergent complexity beyond traditional models. This is complemented by a more realistic wealth distribution, aligning agent behavior with empirical realities. The aim is to generate more realistic trading volumes from background activity while still producing sensible price evolution.

**We expect to push to the repository at ~15:00 UTC.**  Deployment to our validator will be executed ~2H following the push, assuming no issues encountered.

@taos・79 ☯️ The updates described earlier https://discord.com/channels/799672011265015819/1353733356470276096/1422935968071155764 have been pushed, and will be deployed at our vali in ~2 hours if all goes well at testnet.  :partyfast:
Apologies for the delay, some checks and tests took longer than planned.

**Miners**
Update should not be strictly necessary, but we strongly recommend to obtain the latest version to avoid any issues.  Simply run `git pull && pip install -e . && pm2 restart <miner process>` to update.


If your update handling pipeline includes proxy testing using the simulation config, you may want to check behaviour against the latest version.

Note as always that the latest update is now deployed and will soon be running on our testnet (netuid 366).
We encourage miners to activate testnet agents if possible, and report any issues so as to ensure the function ahead of deployment to live.
Dashboard is available at [testnet.simulate.trading](https://testnet.simulate.trading/).

@taos・79  ☯️ Version 0.1.36 has now been deployed at our validator 🦾
This update requires a full recompile of the simulator so will take a bit of time before the new simulation begins.
Note that the full effect of the state communication optimizations may not be present immediately as we have kept the slower parsing logic with validation in place so able to make sure that all messages are properly constructed and handled.  Optimized routine for this will be applied once we are fully confident in the integrity of all handling.

**Validators**
Validators should update by first running `git pull` to receive the latest `run_validator` script, then executing their `run_validator` command as usual.

**Miners**
Recommended to `git pull && pip install -e . && pm2 restart <miner process>` to update to the latest version.

I should also note here for those interested that typically in economics one uses CARA (constant absolute risk aversion) or CRRA utility functions. However, this is mostly due to convenience rather than actual "realism." It is due to simplicity of finding solutions, not necessarily even according to important researchers originally discussing and proposing different utility functions in economics. In particular, Robert Merton (Nobel Prize Winner), one of the most influential economists ever, used HARA utility function rather than the simpler CARA or CRRA: In our computationally already involved setting, such simplifications are no longer necessary, nor even desirable. We have selected HARA for a number of reasons, first being its more general format, but also because many economic relations are derived with the simpler formats, which cast doubt on several outcomes. The classical "treatment" on HARA is https://www.sfu.ca/~kkasa/Merton_71.pdf

@taos・79 ☯️ Have just pushed an additional update:

- **Correct Handling of Leveraged Limit Orders** : A bug in the parsing of limit order instructions had resulted in a failure to apply margin trading requests properly, this is now resolved.
- **Timeout/Retry Preparation** : Structures are added in preparation for a refined version of the handling in cases where validator is not available to receive simulator state updates.
- **Documentation Updates** : Some revisions to README to align with latest, and new FAQ document added.

**Validators**
Please `run_validator` to pull and deploy the latest changes.  
This update includes also an option to disable tmux sessions when using the validator run script; if you would like to update and launch the validator without creating tmux sessions, first `git pull` to obtain the latest script version, then execute your `run_validator` command with `-x 0` appended.

**Miners**
No action necessary, but recommended to update so as to access the total trade volume value now published in state updates.

**The update has been deployed immediately to testnet and mainnet**

Is it possible that one hour in the simulation lasts 12 hours in real time?

Yes, the simulation progression is still quite slow relative to real time; note though of course that there are 40 books simulated.   The latest update addresses a major source of time taken in state processing by validator, but there remain a couple of additional factors contributing here - at least one will be addressed in the next update, but a substantial delay arising in the actual miner query process may require more time to diagnose and correct since primarily occurring internally to the BT package and related to the handling of many concurrent network requests.

@taos・79 ☯️ This week's update consists mostly of refinements, optimizations and improvements resulting from monitoring and investigation of the simulations following last week's major communications upgrade:

* **Simulator<->Validator Communication Refinements** : A couple of improvements, optimizations and enhancements related to the operation of the new communication mechanism are applied.  This includes updates to the state structure to reduce the size of messages by populating composition data only for a limited number of top levels, improving the rate at which states are parsed by the validator and producing smaller messages for transmission to miners, expected to further reduce the time and resources taken in this step.
* **State Saving Optimization** : Following deployment of the new communication mechanism, it has been observed that some time is spent during each state processing round in waiting for simulation state saving to complete; this process has been optimized and re-organised to avoid this and further reduce the delay in processing.
* **Leveraged Order Handling Refinements** : A new scenario arising in the live environment over the last week resulted in another detailed inspection of certain order execution logic within the simulator; a few adjustments and refinements which improve the accuracy of calculations and avoid certain rare scenarios leading to unplanned restarts of the simulator are introduced.

**We expect to push to the repository at ~15:00 UTC.**  Deployment to our validator will be executed ~2H following the push, assuming no issues encountered.

@taos・79 ☯️ The updates described earlier https://discord.com/channels/799672011265015819/1353733356470276096/1425467935811436614 have been pushed, and will be deployed at our vali in ~2 hours if all goes well at testnet.  :partyfast:

**Miners**
Update should not be necessary to continue interacting with validators, but as always we recommend to obtain the latest version to avoid any issues.  Simply run `git pull && pip install -e . && pm2 restart <miner process>` to update.

Note as always that the latest update is now deployed on our testnet (netuid 366).
We encourage miners to activate testnet agents if possible, and report any issues so as to ensure the function ahead of deployment to live.
Dashboard is available at [testnet.simulate.trading](https://testnet.simulate.trading/).

@taos・79  ☯️ Version 0.1.38 has now been deployed at our validator 🦾

**Validators**
Validators should update using the `run_validator` script.

**Miners**
Recommended to `git pull && pip install -e . && pm2 restart <miner process>` to update to the latest version.

Sharing here some insights on the technical achievements we have had in the last few weeks. See the Figures attached. 

Since adopting the MessagePack format in the TAOS <> Validator communication loop, we've made noticeable gains in performance. Figures 1 [validator-out-old.png] and 2 [validator-out-new.png] depict the time taken by the validator to process the simulator state, before and after the update, respectively. Further, Figures 3 [sertimes-rapidjson.png] and 4 [sertimes-msgpack.png] show an order of magnitude improvement in the serialization speed.

Can anyone explain this web dashboard to me a bit? My UID is 116. Nothing seems to match up there. How is it possible that my AF is dropping if I had a trade in recent trades? Specifically, on book 0 and book 11, activity is decreasing even though I had trades on both books in the last 5 minutes. How is it possible that my PnL quote drops on book 20, but none of the recent trades reflect that PnL drop? Either this web dashboard is completely useless and inaccurate, or something else is totally wrong.
@6/. & @7/. fyi Siam Kidd from revenue search said he would be interested in interviewing you.

The stats are accurate; activity begins to drop immediately during any period where no trade is executed - we are likely to extend the assessment window and hence decrease the rate of decay in an upcoming update.  The reported PnL is _unrealized_, and so affected by price movement - the price on book 20 dropped sharply, and you hold a relatively large proportion of BASE currency on this book.

It appears that you have not launched the simulator, only the proxy - the logs indicate this is running correctly and waiting for communication from the simulator.  As per the docs, simulation is launched via:
```
cd /path/to/sn-79/simulate/trading/run 
../build/src/cpp/taosim -f config/simulation_0.xml
```

@taos・79 ☯️ Have just pushed an additional update:

- **Accounting Refinements** : A rare scenario leading to rounding errors resulting in balance inconsistency errors has been resolved.
- **Miner Query Process Configuration** : A couple of changes in networking configuration and the application of timeouts has been applied; this is hoped to improve the consistency of communication between validators and miners while also limiting the time spent in this process.
- **Sharpe Assessment Period Adjustment** : The period over which Sharpe ratio is calculated as well as the minimum observations required to produce valid Sharpe have been increased, this is intended to reduce the rate of decay of activity score and lessen the volatility of miner evaluations.

**Validators**
Please `run_validator` to pull and deploy the latest changes.

**Miners**
No action necessary, the update only affects validator code, but recommended as always to update to the latest.
For what approximate period of real time are the data now taken to evaluate Sharpe and activity?

This was now reduced to 30 minutes to provide a smoother transition.

@6/.  My miner is working correctly and the total processing time per request is less than 0.5s. But every response is timed out on the dashboard for 2 hours(validator: 5EW...) Could you take a look?(uid is 252)

We're currently working on further revisions to query process to help improve success rates, but likely if you are experiencing constant timeouts the issue is in background processes on your end - if you enable `--logging.debug` config option, you will see entries indicating the time taken in decompression of the state update (ex. `Decompressed (0.1489105224609375s)`), this is the most likely culprit in slow response times.  We are looking at optimizations that may be included in the base codebase in a future release, but you should of course ensure sufficient compute to handle this efficiently, and may wish to look into further custom optimization (e.g. parallelization) to accelerate this process.

@taos・79 ☯️ This week's update contains primarily revisions to address recently observed issues:

* **Further Query Process Updates** : Following further investigations and testing, an additional update to the query process which aims to improve success rates while still limiting the total time taken in querying is applied.
* **Simulation Parameter Updates** : Background model parameters are slightly adjusted to address the overly flat price evolution observed recently; more interesting enhancements and additions to the background model are in continuing research and development, more on this soon.
* **Various Minor Fixes & Enhancements** : A couple of additional fixes for handling of newly observed scenarios in the simulator are included, these are hoped to eliminate any further unplanned simulator restarts, or will at least provide additional diagnostic information to assist with debugging in case of any recurrence.

**We expect to push to the repository at ~15:00 UTC.**  Deployment to our validator will be executed ~2H following the push, assuming no issues encountered.
